intro: Lannea cinerea, commonly known as the African sand apple, is a deciduous tree native to eastern and southern Africa. It is characterized by its smooth, grey-brown bark and palmate leaves that are typically 10–20 cm in diameter. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers followed by round, fleshy fruits that turn red when mature. Lannea cinerea is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments, making it a resilient species in savanna ecosystems. It is also valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated for its edible fruits.
